summary: Donald Trump claimed during a meeting with Chuck Todd on May 8th, 2016 that his tax plan is not just a plan, but a proposal. He mentioned that once it is implemented, the Senate and Congress will start working with him and potentially make changes to it.

Donald Trump claimed during a meeting with the press on May 8th, 2016 that under his proposal, he would provide the biggest tax cut of any candidate. However, he acknowledged that he did not believe his proposal would pass. Trump also stated that while the rich may end up paying more, the middle class would be protected and businesses would receive a significant tax cut.

Trump also stated that while the rich may end up paying more, the middle class would be protected and businesses would receive a significant tax cut.

Donald Trump claimed to Chuck Todd that he is not proposing for people to pay more taxes than they are currently paying, but rather suggesting that they might have to pay a little bit more than his own proposal. He also stated that the United States is the highest taxed nation in the world.
Donald Trump claimed to Chuck Todd that his proposal might require certain individuals to pay a little bit more than his original proposal, but not more than what they are currently paying.
